questions.title: Movie Database Function
questions.context: Consider a program that takes an actor's name and returns all movies they have acted in. Is this a function?

explanation.0: This is not a function because it can return multiple movies for a single actor. A function must return exactly one output for each input.

questions.title: Domain and Codomain
questions.context: Let $f$ be a function that converts temperatures from Celsius to Fahrenheit. What is the appropriate domain and codomain for this function?

options.0: Domain: all real numbers, Codomain: all real numbers
options.1: Domain: only positive numbers, Codomain: all real numbers
options.2: Domain: all real numbers, Codomain: only positive numbers
options.3: Domain: only positive numbers, Codomain: only positive numbers

answer: Domain: all real numbers, Codomain: all real numbers

explanation.0: Temperature conversion is defined for all real numbers (including negative temperatures), and the output can also be any real number. Therefore, both domain and codomain should be the set of all real numbers.

questions.title: Function Machine
questions.context: A machine takes a real number $x$ and outputs both $x$ and $-x$. Does this define a function?

explanation.0: This is not a function because it produces two outputs for each input. For example, if x = 3, it outputs both 3 and -3. A function must associate exactly one output to each input.
